00018 /*
00019 
00020 given (A,b,lo,hi), solve the LCP problem: A*x = b+w, where each x(i),w(i)
00021 satisfies one of
00022         (1) x = lo, w >= 0
00023         (2) x = hi, w <= 0
00024         (3) lo < x < hi, w = 0
00025 A is a matrix of dimension n*n, everything else is a vector of size n*1.
00026 lo and hi can be +/- dInfinity as needed. the first `nub' variables are
00027 unbounded, i.e. hi and lo are assumed to be +/- dInfinity.
00028 
00029 we restrict lo(i) <= 0 and hi(i) >= 0.
00030 
00031 the original data (A,b) may be modified by this function.
00032 
00033 if the `findex' (friction index) parameter is nonzero, it points to an array
00034 of index values. in this case constraints that have findex[i] >= 0 are
00035 special. all non-special constraints are solved for, then the lo and hi values
00036 for the special constraints are set:
00037   hi[i] = abs( hi[i] * x[findex[i]] )
00038   lo[i] = -hi[i]
00039 and the solution continues. this mechanism allows a friction approximation
00040 to be implemented. the first `nub' variables are assumed to have findex < 0.
00041 
00042 */
00043 
00044 
00045 #ifndef _BT_LCP_H_
00046 #define _BT_LCP_H_
00047 
00048 #include <stdlib.h>
00049 #include <stdio.h>
00050 #include <assert.h>
00051 
00052 
00053 #include "LinearMath/btScalar.h"
00054 #include "LinearMath/btAlignedObjectArray.h"
00055 
00056 struct btDantzigScratchMemory
00057 {
00058         btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> m_scratch;
00059         btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> L;
00060         btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> d;
00061         btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> delta_w;
00062         btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> delta_x;
00063         btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> Dell;
00064         btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> ell;
00065         btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar*> Arows;
00066         btAlignedObjectArray<int> p;
00067         btAlignedObjectArray<int> C;
00068         btAlignedObjectArray<bool> state;
00069 };
00070 
00071 //return false if solving failed
00072 bool btSolveDantzigLCP (int n, btScalar *A, btScalar *x, btScalar *b, btScalar *w,
00073         int nub, btScalar *lo, btScalar *hi, int *findex,btDantzigScratchMemory& scratch);
00074 
00075 
00076 
00077 #endif //_BT_LCP_H_
